channel.title: What File?!?!?!
channel.description: what file is the ip usually in? i mean what is the file called?

item.title: What File?!?!?!
item.dc:creator: @birdman4657 birdman4657
item.description:
@birdman4657 wrote:

sry i meant it as what type of CLIENT source you are using… as in the original client you are editing…

because some of them require you to change the ip in GUI.java while others you have to edit it in client.java[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 23, 2009, 08:27:46 pm[/size][hr]ok try this…

go into your client.java file (open it with notepad)

search for this

return new Socket

it should look something like this

public final Socket method19(int i)//set the ip throws IOException { if(signlink.mainapp != null) return signlink.opensocket(i); else return new Socket(InetAddress.getByName(Gui.server), i);// sets ip for server when client files is used over gui }

select all of the above and change it to this

public final Socket method19(int i)//set the ip throws IOException { return new Socket(InetAddress.getByName("YOUR IP ADDRESS"), i);// sets ip for server when client files is used over gui }

change YOUR IP ADDRESS to your ip address… lol i hope this helps

Read full topic
